intro: Aster centaurodes, commonly known as the narrowleaf aster, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Aster centaurodes is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
